result.execSummary:
The defendant Sander J Sparks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sander J Sparks

records.addlTxt:
10:48 AM Defendant Sander J Sparks in court.  Attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger in court for Sander J Sparks.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Ct. 2: GUILTY
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY. Ct.  is dismissed  but read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$750 fine+ Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay.

BTC: Defendant is eligible for expungement one year from today's date.

9:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sander J Sparks in court.  Attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger in court for Sander J Sparks. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense the case is resolved however does have restitution to work on
State makes statements on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
